doc.title: Technical Specification: Research-Validated Content & Portfolio Implementation
doc.snippet: Epic 2 introduces premium execution components with GSAP orchestrated timelines, organic shapes (blob, hexagon), magnetic pull interactions, and signature easing curves. Story 2.1 is the first production application of these patterns: OrganicCard blob shapes, useMagneticPull cursor-following, useOrchestrator 5-phase timeline builder. All components integrate with existing Epic 1 infrastructure (GSAP 3.13.0 + ScrollTrigger, Lenis 1.3.11, dark indigo/cyan/fuchsia palette).

doc.title: Frontend Architecture
doc.snippet: All components must: export TypeScript interface, use semantic HTML tags, implement responsive Tailwind classes (mobile-first), use cn() utility for className merging, add loading="lazy" for images, include JSDoc comments. React cleanup patterns required: useEffect return cleanup for GSAP context (ctx.revert()). Component size guidelines: <300 lines (prefer <200), functions <50 lines, files <500 lines.

doc.title: Animation Patterns & Best Practices
doc.snippet: GSAP ScrollTrigger used for scroll-linked animations. Critical pattern: gsap.context() for scoped animations with cleanup (ctx.revert() in useEffect return). Animate transform and opacity only (GPU acceleration). ScrollTrigger on timeline (not individual tweens). Stagger reveals use stagger.amount for total duration. Example: gsap.from('.card', {opacity: 0, y: 60, stagger: 0.15, scrollTrigger: {trigger: ref, start: 'top 80%', toggleActions: 'play none none reverse'}})

doc.title: Animation Patterns & Best Practices
doc.snippet: Lenis provides global smooth scroll foundation. Connect to GSAP via lenis.on('scroll', ScrollTrigger.update) and gsap.ticker.add((time) => lenis.raf(time * 1000)). Already configured globally in project. Components should not reinitialize Lenis.

doc.title: Epic 2 Premium Components - Usage Guide
doc.snippet: Epic 2 foundation components (Story 2.0 - production ready): OrganicCard (4 shape variants: blob, hexagon, organic, floating with morphing), useMagneticPull (cursor-following magnetic effect, throttled 60fps, mobile detection), useOrchestrator (GSAP master timeline builder with ScrollTrigger integration), CRE8TIVE_EASINGS (signature easing: organic, smooth, spring, cinematic), usePerformanceMonitor (FPS tracking with graceful degradation). Import pattern: import { OrganicCard, useMagneticPull, useOrchestrator } from '@/components/epic2'

doc.title: Technical Specification: Epic 2
doc.snippet: Performance targets: 60fps (16.67ms frame budget). OrganicCard blob shapes (3-5 cards): Low CPU, Medium GPU, limit ≤3 glows/viewport. Magnetic Pull: Medium CPU (mousemove), Low GPU (transform only), 16ms throttle, disable on mobile (<768px). GSAP Timeline (5 phases): Low CPU, High GPU, ≤12 elements/timeline. Mobile optimization: disable magnetic pull <768px, static OrganicCard shapes (no morphing), simplified ScrollTrigger animations if <30fps detected.

constraints.constraint: - Max 300 LOC per component file (prefer <200 LOC) - Max 50 lines per function - Max 500 lines per file - If PortfolioSection exceeds 300 LOC, extract PortfolioCard to separate file

- 60fps target (16.67ms frame budget per frame) - GSAP timeline: max 12 elements per timeline (5-phase sequence) - OrganicCard blob shapes: limit ≤3 glows per viewport - Magnetic pull: 16ms throttle (60fps max), disabled on mobile (<768px) - Mobile optimization: static shapes (no morphing), no magnetic pull - GPU acceleration: animate transform and opacity only (no width/height/top/left)

- ALWAYS use gsap.context() with cleanup (ctx.revert() in useEffect return) - ScrollTrigger on timeline (NOT on individual tweens) - Lenis already configured globally (do not reinitialize) - Use will-change: transform, opacity for GPU hints - Throttle cleanup: gsap.utils.throttle.kill() in useMagneticPull cleanup

- Mobile-first Tailwind classes (no prefix = mobile, md: = tablet+) - Mobile (375px): 1 column grid, static shapes, no magnetic pull - Tablet (768px): 2 column grid, static shapes, magnetic pull enabled - Desktop (1024px+): 3 column grid, morphing shapes, full magnetic pull - Breakpoints: sm (640px), md (768px), lg (1024px), xl (1280px), 2xl (1536px)

- Export all component interfaces (PortfolioSectionProps, PortfolioCardProps) - Use semantic HTML tags (<section>, <article>, <h2>) for SEO - JSDoc comments for all components - No implicit any (though project tsconfig allows it, avoid in new code) - Reuse Epic 2 types: OrganicCardProps, MagneticPullOptions, AnimationPhase

- Tailwind utility classes only (no custom CSS) - cn() utility for className merging - Glassmorphism pattern: bg-gradient-to-br from-indigo-500/10 to-fuchsia-500/10, backdrop-filter: blur(20px) - Studios color palette: orange (#EA580C), teal (#0891B2), coral accents - Do NOT copy Briefing Engine colors (dark indigo/cyan/fuchsia)

- Zero automated tests (project has no test infrastructure yet) - Manual testing required: Chrome DevTools Performance tab for 60fps validation - Browser testing: Chrome 100+, Firefox 100+, Safari 15+ (latest versions) - Mobile testing: viewport emulation in DevTools + real device if available

- All copy MUST match COPY_IMPLEMENTATION_GUIDE.md exactly (no paraphrasing) - StudiosHero headline: "Premium AI Video Production Native for Every Platform" - Industry citation: "86% of enterprise brands adopting AI video by 2026 — Lemonlight Industry Report, 2025" - Portfolio section header: "Real Work. Real Results." - CTA: "Ready to create professional-grade video for your platforms? [Button: Start Your Project]"

- Story 2.0 (Epic 2 foundation) is production-ready and tested - Do NOT modify Epic 2 foundation components (OrganicCard, useMagneticPull, useOrchestrator) - Import from '@/components/epic2' barrel export - Follow existing project patterns in src/components/studios/ directory - Use FadeIn wrapper from '@/components/shared/FadeIn' for scroll reveals (optional)

interface.name: OrganicCardProps
interface.signature: { children: ReactNode, shape?: 'blob' | 'hexagon' | 'organic' | 'floating', glowColor?: string, morphing?: boolean, morphIntensity?: number, className?: string }
interface.usage: PortfolioCard must use OrganicCard with shape="blob", optional glowColor (e.g., '#0891B2'), morphing enabled on desktop only (>=1024px), morphIntensity 0.05 (±5% variance)

interface.name: MagneticPullOptions
interface.signature: { strength?: number, maxDistance?: number, ease?: string, rotation?: boolean, rotationIntensity?: number }
interface.usage: useMagneticPull({ strength: 0.3, maxDistance: 30, ease: 'power2.out' }). Apply to PortfolioCard wrapper. Returns ref to attach to element. Automatically disabled on mobile (<768px).

interface.name: AnimationPhase
interface.signature: { name: string, targets: string | HTMLElement[], animation: gsap.TweenVars, stagger?: number | gsap.StaggerVars, position?: string | number }
interface.usage: Define 5 phases for PortfolioSection timeline: 1) title reveal (0-0.8s), 2) card stagger (0.2-1.0s), 3) card angles (0.4-1.2s), 4) spec pills (0.6-1.4s), 5) CTA reveal (0.8-1.6s). Use position: '-=0.6' for overlapping phases.

interface.name: OrchestratorOptions
interface.signature: { trigger: string | HTMLElement, start?: string, end?: string, scrub?: number | boolean, pin?: boolean, markers?: boolean }
interface.usage: useOrchestrator({ trigger: containerRef.current, start: 'top 75%', end: 'bottom center', scrub: false }). ScrollTrigger toggleActions: 'play none none reverse'. Use addPhase() method to add 5 animation phases.

interface.name: PortfolioItem
interface.signature: { clientName: string, industry: string, challenge: string, fullStackProduction: string[], delivered: string, specs: { formats: string, resolution: string, duration: string }, videoUrl?: string, thumbnailUrl?: string }
interface.usage: Define 3-5 client case studies following COPY_IMPLEMENTATION_GUIDE.md Portfolio Card Template (lines 66-104). Each item follows "challenge → solution → deliverables" format. fullStackProduction array has 5 production steps.

interface.name: PortfolioSectionProps
interface.signature: { title: string, subtitle: string, portfolioItems: PortfolioItem[], ctaText: string, ctaLink: string }
interface.usage: Main container component props. title: "Real Work. Real Results.", subtitle from copy guide, portfolioItems: PORTFOLIO_DATA array, ctaText: "Start Your Project", ctaLink: "/contact"

interface.name: PortfolioCardProps
interface.usage: Sub-component that renders single portfolio item. Wraps OrganicCard with portfolio content: client name, industry, challenge, production steps, deliverables, spec pills, optional video embed.
